alfredsnippet.snippet:
Etienne Klein & Marc Lachi√®ze-Rey, The Quest for Unity - The Adventure of Physics, p.97

"... knowing that someone 'is a physicist' tells nothing about what he or she really does  ... In contrast to realism ... positivism holds that the very essence of science boils down to correctly predicting observations. Everything else adds up to aesthetic thrills, rhetorical games, and plain hot air."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Everything Other than Correctly Predicting Observations is Hot Air
